intro: Olearia traversii, commonly known as the Stewart Island daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and they bloom in spring and summer. Olearia traversii is an important component of New Zealand's native flora and is often found in scrub and forest margins.
